intro: Haworthia intermedia var. livida, commonly known as the Zebra Haworthia, is a compact, succulent plant native to South Africa. It features distinctive, triangular leaves with a pale green color and prominent white to grayish markings that resemble a zebra's stripes. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–15 centimeters and has a rosette shape, making it visually striking. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires bright, indirect light to maintain its characteristic appearance. Due to its unique look and low maintenance, it is a popular choice for indoor gardening.
